name: Match of the Day
description: There was a massive wave of football management games in 1992, and this was Zeppelin's contender. It was licensed around the BBC's football highlights programme famed for its classic theme music. The standard options exist (such as training, transfers and tactics) but the control system is unique. A diary is presented on the table, and you have to drag the icons for the activities you want to focus that amount of time on. This not only makes the presentation and style unusual, but also accurately represents the limited amount of time a real manager has.
alsoFor: Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64 | Combined View

shot.caption: here I choose my team. This is done by scrolling through a list using the arrow keys
The game starts with the managers diary. icons are selected, then placed into the time slots in the book
This is the first day completed
The green icon (middle of 3rd row down) shows the teams position in the league
The yellow arrow in the margin of the diary goes to the scheduled task.....
... in this case team selection. Selecting a player brings up their stats
The icon in the top right brings up the cash / wages screen
The blue icin, (3rd row down on the right) brings up the fixtures list
The cassette option (bottom row on the left) brings up the save / load screen
